DataElement.preferredName: Participant Health Care Provider Assessment Family Skin Carcinoma History Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Date of health care provider questioning about the incidence of skin cancer within a person's family.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Participant Health Care Provider Assessment Family Skin Carcinoma History
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Health care provider questioning about the incidence of skin cancer within a person's family.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Persons who provides health care as part of their job responsibilities, or a person or organization who is licensed to supply health care.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: Persons who provides health care as part of their job responsibilities: or a person or organization who is licensed to supply health care.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Property.preferredName: Family Skin Carcinoma Personal Medical History
Property.preferredDefinition: Family; a domestic group, or a number of domestic groups linked through descent (demonstrated or stipulated) from a common ancestor, marriage, or adoption.:Skin cancer that arises in basal cells or squamous cells but not in melanocytes (pigment-producing cells of the skin).:an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

Concepts.definition: A domestic group, or a number of domestic groups linked through descent (demonstrated or stipulated) from a common ancestor, marriage, or adoption.
A carcinoma that arises from the skin.  Representative examples are basal cell carcinoma and squamous cell carcinoma.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Observations and activities relating to behavior, such as smoking and ETOH use.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Date as required for Clinical Trials Monitoring Service submissions.  Exchange format is YYYYMMDD.  Display format is DDMMMYYYY, with the month display the first three letters of each month (Jan, Feb, Mar, etc.).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/30/17 jk Transferred context, added CSI and reg status, released per Round 5 finalization task. --- Display and exchange formats are based on CTMS reporting requirements v.3.02 and all subsequent versions of these guidelines.
